reviews.review: Sin duda el mejor de su genero. Por una lado tetrico por otro lado una bomba de adrenalina. He jugado otros juegos de este tipo y llegue un poco a tarde a este, no me arrepiento de nada. Eso si, eso de el limite de 60 fps tira por la borda la fluides para los que tienen buenos equipos, lo unico que he de quejarme.

This is the most unbalanced game I ever played to many bugs and the game is absolute shit, sometimes when you try to attack a survivor the hit doesn't even count. Don't even  get me stated on the balancing if the survivors have a med kit and a flashlight just know its game over. they are to many op perks for the survivors (the killers to) . the game is fun and all right when your a survivor but its a pain in the ass when your a killer. For this to be a team based game when your a survivor there is no text chat or voice chat u have to use discord or sum but i mostly play with randoms.The matchmaking in this game is also broken as u can see I only have less than 7 hours on this game and I would still get matched with people who are like over level 100 who have better perks n stuff this game really really really  needs sbm. Some of the killers are unbalanced i'm not trying to sound like pussy ass sore loser but I'm new and ima be honest i have rage quit because of some of the killers. In conclusion do not buy this game unless u like unbalanced piece of shit games its only 20 bucks and its not even worth that -_-

In a recent stream-interview-type-thing, an integral developer at Behaviour Interactive was asked about the balance of a survivor perk called Object of Obsession, OoO for short. OoO allows a survivor to essentially wallhack the majority of killers so long as the killer is far enough away, and if the survivor's in-engine cone of vision is over the killer. If that survivor is queuing with their buddies and in a Discord call, they can relay that information at all times, whenever they want. Or, if solo, they can use it to actively distract, and keep tabs on killers so that the other survivors can do objectives. The only downside is that the killer can see the survivor as well. [b]A survivor can view a killer through a wall even if the killer is not looking in their direction.[/b]

They responded nonchalantly, and even claimed the perk itself was a non-issue despite years of community outcry. Behaviour Interactive then proceeded to launch the newest $6.99 quarterly expansion, Binding of Kin, which included a killer that was completely mechanically broken and unplayable, and had a variety of perks which did not mechanically function properly, if at all. 

This review isn't about meta issues, because let's be honest-- [b]Dead By Daylight is a party game[/b]. It is not a competitive, 5v5 MOBA or strategy shooter. Nurse, Spirit ( with beads i guess lol ), Decisive Strike and Unbreakable are the way they are because this game is not catered to a competitive mindset, and it shouldn't be. So, when do issues arise? Well, they arise when a killer launches and just does not work. When perks launch and just do not work. When the game that actively uses a public testing build regularly launches its major paid content with little to no change compared to its testing build. When instead of fixing old problems, new ones are created via reworks and additions no one asked for. Dead By Daylight is a respectable, nice car that Behaviour Interactive continues to repaint without thinking to give it a nice wash beforehand.

There is polish, and there is quality, but in all the wrong places. Dead By Daylight has evolved within its community and the way its played, and its developers have just not caught on. They do not understand what makes this game tick anymore. They don't understand why people play it. And while it's well in the rights of a developer to make the product they want, there's no hand-holding in regards to releasing unfinished, underwhelming content amongst a tidal community that just wants the thing to function properly.

Dead By Daylight is one of the most clever, unique, and surprisingly addictive games in the semi-mainstream... And is the only of its archetype to really have any longevity, which results in a lack of competition, which results in a lack of consistent ingenuity. Until shit hits the fan, or until Behaviour gets a reason to actually develop their game, it's gonna stay that way.
Es genial, me gusto los cambios que hicieron al igual que los nuevos personajes y escenarios.

even tho this is 2021, i still like this game.

The game itself is a fun concept with good gameplay. But the community is toxic, and rather want to abuse exploits just to mess with you, than play the game making it more fun for all of the players involved. The matchmaking is horrible as well (they are going to change the way it works but till then it's a big negative), new and low ranked players can go up against player who have 100s of hours in the game. This just makes the game one sided, and a lot of times these higher ranked people will even mess with the new player just for their own laughs. There's also a lot of balancing issues, especially at higher ranks people tend to only run 6-8 perks out of all the options, just because they are better than the others in most situations. This is both true for killers and survivors. Imo a bit more for the survivors because they are basically all the same character in the end, and killers do have different gameplay but even then there's a few that are almost mandatory on everyone just to be better. A lot of these perks are also locked behind multiple secondary paywalls. There is technically a way to gain some in-game currency with which you can, if you get lucky, get perks from the dlc. But the currency is hard to gain and the costs for these dlc items is very high in comparison. So no, I can't recommend the game, especially not for new players, in the current state.

This game is not worth your time for these reasons:

1) Bugs. This game is riddled with a variety of game breaking bugs, and has been for every single patch.

2) Apathetic developers. The game has no accessibility options, and is especially miserable to play for colorblind players. The recent HUD update makes this issue even worse. Even if accessibility options aren't important to you, the  game is riddled with 'bully tools', in the form of perks like NOED and Object of Obsession, or tools like keys, that make the game absolutely miserable when one team decides to bring them.

3) Grind. The game is a monotonous slog. The way you level up your characters is by using a mechanic called 'the blood web', a randomly generated skill tree. It takes literally billions of blood points to level up your characters and get the perks you want. After over one thousand hours of playing this game, I'm still nowhere even close.

Please, don't make the same mistake I did, and waste your time and money on this product.
